dmca.title: Lawsuit - Morton did not follow thru, but I will - Hall of Shame
dmca.body:
From: eb <rudyrudy3@comcast.net>
To: ufowatchdog@msn.com
Subject: Lawsuit - Morton did not follow thru, but I will - Hall of  Shame
Date: Mon, 28 Aug 2006 01:27:54

I'm serious, Royce.

You can post this as a "ha-ha-ha he will do nothing", but I
will. I promise
it.

I live just 30 miles from your ISP/webhost (in San Ramon) and I
will sue
them and name you as co-defendant.

Contra Costa Superior Court.

You can fly down here for the trial.

I'm a Taurus, and I will follow thru. I have been considerng
tnis for
years,and now I >>will<< do it. I see you dumped some of the
stuff on me,
but I want it all to go.

Copyright violations on photos, ($50,000 a pop), and libel,
maybe
$1,000,000 - You seriously affest sales of my

new book, and lectures.

Linda and Jim will join in.  

Act now, I'll be contacting legal dept of site5.com  Tuesday.
They already
have email. I'll also contact their
president/owner. I will. It will not be worth $9.95 a month web
host fee to
get sued about you.

                    100% serious. No playing around.

                            Jon-Erik Beckjord, MBA (and 1 yr law
studies UC
Berkeley)
**************************

I received this message on 29-AUG-06, shortly after which my website account was terminated due to a legal threat my webhost had received from the same person.  I then received another message from the person threatening legal action:

From: eb <rudyrudy3@comcast.net>
To: ufowatchdog@msn.com
Subject: Goodbye. Do not reappear on net
Date: Mon, 28 Aug 2006 13:53:18

I will sue you wherever you appear, no matter where.

                     Beckjord
*****************************

My website was down for several days and I was forced to move to a new host, which is costing me more money now.  I was shocked that my entire website could be shut down with one e-mail threat and no actual lawsuit.  Any assistance or advice would be greatly appreciated.  I was sued in 2003 by someone in California claiming that I had libeled them.  They lost the suit after they were hit with a SLAPP.
